triples.name: Deepfake
triples.relevance: Paper examines the societal and political impact of deepfake synthetic videos on public trust and discourse.

triples.name: Disinformation
triples.relevance: Paper integrates existing theories about how disinformation undermines trust in news and media.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI is the enabling technology that creates deepfakes and synthetic videos analyzed in the paper.

triples.name: Synthetic media
triples.relevance: Paper studies effects of synthetic media technology on viewer perception and trust in political context.

triples.name: Visual communication
triples.relevance: Paper integrates theories about the persuasive power of visual communication in understanding deepfake impact.

triples.name: Uncertainty
triples.relevance: Paper builds on uncertainty theory to explain how deepfakes increase doubt and reduce trust in media.

triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: Social media is the distribution platform where deepfakes spread and where trust in news is measured.

triples.name: Civic political culture
triples.relevance: Paper examines how deepfakes threaten democratic civic culture and public discourse institutions.
